intro: Palicourea nayana, commonly known as the golden leaf vine, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe. Palicourea nayana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
